clinical_study.brief_title: Prospective Follow up of Minimally Invasive Chest Wall Surgery After Trauma
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Follow-up of Patients Treated With Muscle Sparing, Minimally Invasive Open Surgical Technique for Unstable Chest Wall After Trauma

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the outcome of a muscle sparing, minimally invasive open surgical technique for unstable ribcage injuries after trauma. The investigators will compare the results from the study participants to a historical cohort who were operated with a different surgical technique with large incisions and simultaneous thoracotomy.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a prospective follow-up study where the investigators aim to study patients who have undergone surgery with a muscle sparing, minimally invasive technique for unstable ribcage after trauma. The investigators plan on seeing the participants as out patients 6 months and 1 year after surgery. The results will be compared to results from a historical cohort with patients who participated in earlier studies with a different surgical method with large incisions and simultaneous thoracotomy. The investigators plan on including 50 patients since a preliminary analysis has suggested this should be enough to notice statistically significant differences between the groups.

primary_outcome.measure: Forced vital capacity of the lungs.
primary_outcome.description: Forced vital capacity (VC) measured with spirometry.

primary_outcome.measure: Forced expiratory volume of the lungs.
primary_outcome.description: Forced expiratory volume in 1 second (FEV1) measured with spirometry.

primary_outcome.measure: Forced expiratory volume percent of the lungs.
primary_outcome.description: Forced expiratory volume in 1 second divided with forced vital capacity, measured with spirometry.

primary_outcome.measure: Peak expiratory flow of the lungs.
primary_outcome.description: Peak expiratory flow measured with spirometry.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Six months and one year after surgery.
secondary_outcome.description: Degree of disability assessed with Disability Rating Index (DRI) scale ranging from 0-100 where higher scores indicate more disability.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Six months and one year after surgery.
secondary_outcome.description: Physical activity assessed with Grimby activity scale ranging from 1-6 where 6 indicates the highest level of activity.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Six months and one year after surgery.
secondary_outcome.description: Shoulder mobility assessed with Boström index, a scale ranging from 5-30 for each shoulder where 30 represents the greatest range of movement.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Six months and one year after surgery.
secondary_outcome.description: Movement of chest wall during respiration measured with Respiratory Movement Measuring Instrument (RMMI).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Six months and one year after surgery.
secondary_outcome.description: Strength of respiratory muscles measured with Maximal Inspiratory Pressure (MIP) and Maximal Expiratory Pressure (MEP).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Six months and one year after surgery.
secondary_outcome.description: Quality of life assessed with the EuroQol (European Quality of Life) Five Dimension Five Level Scale (EQ-5D-5L). A 5-dimensional scale in which each dimension has 5 levels where 1 represents the best outcome and 5 represents the worst outcome.
Radiological signs of healing of the participants rib fractures assessed with CT scan. Fractures will be denoted as healed, partially healed or with no signs of healing.

clinical_study.condition: Rib; Fracture, Multiple, With Flail Chest

arm_group.description: Patients who underwent surgery with a muscle sparing, minimally invasive technique for unstable chest wall after trauma.
Patients who underwent surgery with large incisions and simultaneous thoracotomy for unstable chest wall after trauma.

intervention.intervention_name: Minimally invasive surgical fixation of unstable rib cage
intervention.description: Minimally invasive and muscle sparing surgical fixation of ribs and/or sternum in an unstable segment of the chest wall (flail chest) with titan plates or medullary nails (MatrixRib Fixation System, DepuySynthes).

intervention.intervention_name: Large incision surgical fixation of unstable rib cage.
intervention.description: Surgical fixation of ribs and/or sternum in an unstable segment of the chest wall (flail chest) with titan plates or medullary nails (MatrixRib Fixation System, DepuySynthes). Large non muscle sparing incision with simultaneous thoracotomy.

study_pop.textblock: Patients surgically treated at our trauma ward for unstable chest wall due to trauma. Consecutive sampling.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with chest wall trauma who underwent surgical stabilisation for unstable chest wall using a minimally invasive, muscle sparing technique without thoracotomy or thoracoscopy no more than 6 months prior to inclusion.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Severe head injury (Abbreviated Injury score (AIS) >3)
- Spinal injury
- Neurological or musculoskeletal disease affecting chest wall mobility
